private_information: I can only manipulate blocks that are vowels: A, E, I.
I can only move the top block of any stack and I can move only one block at a time.
I can place a moved block either on the table or on top of another block that currently has its top exposed.
vowel_agent.goal: Help achieve the final stack configuration where A is on B, B is on C, C is on D, D is on E, E is on F, F is on G, G is on H, H is on I, I is on J, J is on K, K is on L, L is on M, M is on N and N is on the table.

private_information: I can only manipulate blocks that are consonants: B, L, N, G, J, M, C, K, F, D, H.
I can only move the top block of any stack and I can move only one block at a time.
I can place a moved block either on the table or on top of another block that currently has its top exposed.
consonant_agent.goal: Help achieve the final stack configuration where A is on B, B is on C, C is on D, D is on E, E is on F, F is on G, G is on H, H is on I, I is on J, J is on K, K is on L, L is on M, M is on N and N is on the table.

private_information: I coordinate the two agents to produce a single coherent plan that respects the agents' movement restrictions.
I integrate local move proposals and produce a final PDDL domain and problem for the FastDownward solver.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a combined PDDL domain and PDDL problem that achieves the target stack configuration from the given initial configuration, keeping agent actions distinct.

public_information: There are 14 uniquely labelled blocks: B, E, L, A, N, G, J, M, C, K, F, D, H, I.
Blocks are arranged in two stacks on the table. Stack 1 bottom-to-top is B, E, N, G, M, K, F, I. Stack 2 bottom-to-top is L, A, J, C, D, H.
Agents can only manipulate the top block of any stack.
Agents can move only one block at a time.
One agent is restricted to moving vowel blocks A, E, I. The other agent is restricted to moving consonant blocks.
Goal configuration is a single stack with bottom N on the table and then M on N, L on M, K on L, J on K, I on J, H on I, G on H, F on G, E on F, D on E, C on D, B on C, A on B.

analyze.system_prompt: You are vowel_agent. You are aware of the public environment facts referenced as {environment->public_information}. Use your private information at {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}. Your role is to produce a concise list of feasible local moves and constraints that you can perform given your capabilities and the current visible configuration. Describe move primitives and any assumptions you need without producing PDDL. Provide your output as a structured list of steps or constraints named vowel_agent_plan.
analyze.prompt: You are vowel_agent. Public facts: {environment->public_information}. Your private facts: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->vowel_agent->goal}. Provide a stepwise local move plan and any constraints that you require from other agents for those moves. Do not emit PDDL. Output should be captured as vowel_agent_plan.

analyze.system_prompt: You are consonant_agent. You are aware of the public environment facts referenced as {environment->public_information}. Use your private information at {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. Your role is to produce a concise list of feasible local moves and constraints that you can perform given your capabilities and the current visible configuration. Describe move primitives and any assumptions you need without producing PDDL. Provide your output as a structured list of steps or constraints named consonant_agent_plan.
analyze.prompt: You are consonant_agent. Public facts: {environment->public_information}. Your private facts: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->consonant_agent->goal}. Provide a stepwise local move plan and any constraints that you require from other agents for those moves. Do not emit PDDL. Output should be captured as consonant_agent_plan.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Your job is to integrate the local plans and constraints produced by the agents into a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem formatted for the FastDownward planner. Keep the actions of the two agents distinct by prefixing or otherwise naming actions to indicate the acting agent. Ensure the domain specifies the predicates and actions necessary to model top-only moves, one-block-at-time moves, and agent-specific move permissions. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target FastDownward compatibility.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You receive the following inputs: vowel_agent_plan: {vowel_agent_plan} and consonant_agent_plan: {consonant_agent_plan}. Public facts: {environment->public_information}. Orchestrate these inputs into a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem that achieve the global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Keep agent actions distinct and preserve any constraints reported by agents. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> tags and the problem in <problem></problem> tags. The produced PDDL should be usable by FastDownward.
